situation: A few players are playing a boardgame. The current state of the game is as follows. The german shepherd has a card that is green in color, and is 22 weeks old. The peafowl has a banana-strawberry smoothie. The peafowl is watching a movie from 2017. And the rules of the game are as follows. Rule1: For the camel, if you have two pieces of evidence 1) that peafowl does not fall on a square that belongs to the camel and 2) that german shepherd reveals something that is supposed to be a secret to the camel, then you can add camel will never refuse to help the ostrich to your conclusions. Rule2: The peafowl will not fall on a square of the camel if it (the peafowl) has something to drink. Rule3: Here is an important piece of information about the peafowl: if it is watching a movie that was released before Shaquille O'Neal retired then it does not fall on a square that belongs to the camel for sure. Rule4: Here is an important piece of information about the german shepherd: if it is less than 3 years old then it reveals a secret to the camel for sure. Rule5: If the german shepherd has a card whose color appears in the flag of Belgium, then the german shepherd reveals something that is supposed to be a secret to the camel.
question: Based on the game state and the rules and preferences, does the camel refuse to help the ostrich?
label: disproved
